On Thu, 2002-10-31 at 18:05, Morten Grum, PH-Consult wrote:
> Is there a simple way to test that a class follows the bean
> conventions?
> 
> Does someone perhaps have a method like this?
>       assertBean("Should be a java bean", MyClass.class());

Not entirely sure what you want to check here. The only requirement to
be a Java Bean is that it has a zero-argument constructor. It would be
possible, also, to provide a list of properties, and verify those. For
example:
	assertBean(MyClass.class, readWriteProperties(), readOnlyProperties(),
writeOnlyProperties())

However, without the list, you would not be be able to say what should
be properties; the mere presence of a member field would not be
sufficient, for example.

> If not. How could I make it?

By reflection, and the use of the BeanInfo class.

Robert.
